docs.title: Overview
docs.text: This is the documentation for a nosepoke that is used for neuroscience experiments. It was developed in the Karpova Lab at HHMI's Janelia research campus. It is a pyControl compatible device.

docs.title: Features
docs.text:
• Vibration

    Provide haptic feedback using an integrated vibration motor.

  • Distance

    A time of flight sensor acquires analog distance data that is independent of the object's reflectance.

  • Light

    A controllable white LED illuminates the inside of the nosepoke from above.

  • Liquid delivery

    An integrated channel dispenses liquid to the front of the port. 1/8" tubing can easily be attached using the push-to-connect fitting.

docs.title: Panels
docs.text:
The nosepoke is mounted to a panel which is slotted into place to make up the back wall of the behavior arena. The panel integrates a flexure to isolate the vibrating nosepoke so the vibrations are actually felt by the rat instead of being absorbed by the mass of the surrounding rig.

  • Process: Water jet cutting
  • Material: 1/8" aluminum
  • Files:
    • side_panel.dxf
    • side_panel.step
    • center_panel.dxf
    • center_panel.step
